experience.name: UPMC Enterprises
experience.summary: Developed and led development of software to make create better outcomes for patients

positions.title: Software Engineer, Senior
duties: I continued focusing on mentorship and championing best practices while leading my team while also deepening my own skills and knowledge.
After the radiology project wound down, I did some exploration of the SPA landscape and advocated for UPMCE to start using React in it's projects.
My next project was contributing to and then leading a team working on a Java Spring Boot data transformation solution.
My next two projects were with small teams of two or three, so my focus was on code contribution and learning new technologies like Vue 2.
The COVID-19 pandemic disrupted that second project, and I was loaned out to a portfolio company using React for its front-end and was introduced to the Fluent UI library.
Since February 2021, I've been working on a doctor-to-doctor telemedicine driver using primarily full-stack JavaScript with express and Vue 2.
I also led an effort to develop a companion application using TypeScript, Vue 3, and GraphQL.

positions.title: Software Engineer, Intermediate
duties: Coinciding with my promotion was a drastic increase in responsibility as I was chosen to lead an existing team.
The primary expectation of me was mentorship, which I did through pairing, championing best practice, and honing the strengths of each team member.
I delivered several presentations and in-house trainings on good testing practices.
I continued to make contribute to the project as an individual, deepening my skills, especially around JavaScript.

positions.title: Software Engineer, Associate
duties: My first projects were rapid prototyping technical or UX solutions for testing and validation.
That work evolved into contributing to a global team writing a full-stack radiology workflow driver application using Java and AngularJs.
My role on the team and the role of our team in the larger structure was focused on (but not limited to) UI and UX development.

experience.name: Datel Software Solutions
experience.summary: Built and maintained software to harness VOIP data to aid call center managers

positions.title: Junior Developer
duties: I contributed code to developed and maintain a system that processes real-time call data from phone systems into reports and real-time monitoring.
My initial duties focusing on building tests and smashing bugs in the .NET existing system, focused primarily on the C# code.
When needed, I worked on custom changes for specific customer needs.
Led development against a new phone system using a combination of real world data and a "lab" setup.

experience.name: Pittsburgh Technical Institute (now Pittsburgh Technical College )
experience.summary: Helped faculty teach students the fundamentals of software development

positions.title: Teacher's Assistant
duties: After my first year of formal training, the department head chose another student and I to be TAs for the next cohort of students.
I assisted the head of the department with classes by giving students guidance, practical advice, and troubleshooting help.

experience.name: Freelance Web Development
experience.summary: Through self-motivated learning, discovered my passion for creating software that people use and enjoy

positions.title: Independent Contractor
duties: Self-taught, I developed and maintained websites for a variety of clients.
My clients were primarily non-profit organizations, from community groups to nation-wide lobbying firms.

skills.name: Modern JavaScript Web Frameworks
skills.summary: Extensive experience with development of modern JavaScript web applications

skills.name: API Design and Implementation
skills.summary: Experience with a wide variety of backend technologies and patterns

skills.name: Agile Methodologies
skills.summary: Years of developing on teams using agile to plan and improve

skills.name: Collaboration and Leadership
skills.summary: Solid record of teamwork from colocated teams of two devs to globally distributed multiteam tracks of 50 devs

skills.name: Self-motivated
skills.summary: From roots as a self-taught freelancer, always eagerly exploring new technologies without losing sight of the present-day goals

skills.name: Quality-minded
skills.summary: Champion of testing with an emphasis on building confidence in those tests to reduce the risk of change
